author: Staff Reporter
Karthik Madhavan
text:
The civic body has asked owners of meat, beef, pork and poultry stalls to shut down shutters on January 16 (Saturday) on account of Tiruvalluvar Day. The order follows a State Government direction that bans slaughter of animals, birds and their meat sale on the day, according to a press release. The abattoirs will also remain closed and those who violate the rule will face penal action.

In another release, the Corporation says the same order will also apply on January 24 (Sunday) observed as Vallalar Ramalinga Adigalar death anniversary. - Staff Reporter
title: No meat sales on January 16
